text:
Hi All , I've an issue when calling the get all  engagement method. When making the below call, we are getting back the attached response with "has more: true" and the offset ID.
<https://api.hubapi.com/engagements/v1/engagements/paged?hapikey=XXXXXXXXXX&limit=1>
 
 "hasMore": true,
"offset": 7382603659
 
When making the following call with that offset ID, we seem to be getting back the exact same response.
<https://api.hubapi.com/engagements/v1/engagements/paged?hapikey=XXXXXXXXXXX&limit=1&Offset=7382603659>
Hi Tiago, i 'm trying extract something like that, but i can't extratact the properties, can you show me your code make equal
Can I build an entirely custom contact form and submit it using the API without a backend/serverless functions?
I'm hoping to reduce the impact of the forms/v2,js script that HubSpot automatically loads when using their standard form
is this the right endpoint to use? <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>
Yes and yes you found the correct API. It does not require authentication.
Do you know if using the API to handle forms will remove both of these scripts?
these scripts take up almost 50% of all code (does that seem crazy to you?)

If you have no HubSpot forms on your page, the v2 forms JS file will not be loaded. I don’t personally know whether the leadflows script is tied to the forms embed code.

If you replace HubSpot forms with custom code, and submit using the form submission endpoint, you can save on loading that v2 js file.

The downside is that you then will be providing your own JavaScript logic to handle validation, error handling, and displaying a success message or redirecting the browser.
Hi, I am new to HubSpot, I have requirement to push data from HomeAdvisor API to HubSpot, is there a middleware that can directly integrate the data from HomeAdvisor to HubSpot
